content.text: Original By Chosen Clue and EgoBallistic
Hover over options in the menus to learn more about them

content.help:
FPE has its own definition of a month. By default, a FPE month is 3 days, so it takes 27 game days for a full pregnancy to occur.
Do not change too often once FPE features have occurred, as it may have adverse effects. (Recommended)
How many Hours between Refreshes for NPCs & Other Timers, (this won't speed up pregnancies) Default : 12 (Recommended)
How many Hours between Refreshes for the Player, (this won't speed up pregnancies) Default : 12 (Recommended)

When NPCs have contraceptives in their inventory, this option determines whether it will be chance that they use contraceptives, or if they will always use it when sex starts.
Default : Always Use Available Contraceptives
This allows the Player and Others to undress when giving Birth. (You need to redress yourself afterwards) Default: Player Only
This allows you to see semen on the penis or vagina after a sex scene. Default: ON
This allows you to see Blood on the Vagina after a Birth. Default: ON

This option is good for performance only if you are playing as a player looking to get others pregnant.
Do not turn this on if you are a player looking to get pregnant, or are looking for NPC on NPC pregnancy. Default : OFF
Disables pregnancy for other women except the female player character. Will save performance. Default : OFF
Allows females to impregnate other females. Good for futa characters.  This can impregnate both females if they are fertile. Default : OFF
Forces the female Player to be the Father as a result of impregnation of Female to Female Sex Default : OFF
Allows males to get pregnant. Default : OFF
Allows Males to impregnate other Males. Default : OFF
Forces the male Player to be the Father as a result of impregnation during Male to Male Sex Default : OFF

content.text: <font size='12'>These two options(above and below) will conflict with each other. Choose only one</font>
Toggle if the Male Player can be the only Male to get Pregnant
content.help: Disables pregnancy for other men except a male player character. Doesn't affect females. Default : ON
How long it takes for a human pregnancy, in FPE months. (+1 for players because of Labour quest) Default : 9 FP Months
How long it takes for a Ghoul pregnancy, in FPE months. (+1 for players because of Labour quest) Default : 9 FP Months

content.text: <font size='14'>*Creature Pregnancy Length Options is in the Wasteland Offspring MCM</font>
<font size='14'>Lactation products has been moved to Wasteland Dairy Framework</font>
How many Months before Birth, can Lactation begin
content.help: how many months before the due date, can lactation occur in the mother. (Note Lactation can occur during birth) Default : 3
How much the pregnancy will visually affect the pregnant. Base Belly size for pregnancies. (Affects all pregnancies) Default : 5 (Recommended)
Belly size modifier for human pregnancies, applies as a modifier to base Morph Power Default : 1 (Recommended)
Belly size modifier for Ghoul pregnancies, applies as a modifier to base Morph Power Default : 1 (Recommended)

This option leaves some left over body changes for pregnant women, to simulate body growth for breastfeeding.
Note, lasting body morphs is permanent for all actors who have fully gone through pregnancy and are not pregnant. Player still gets reset during reset, however. Default: OFF

content.text: <font size='14'>*Creature Pregnancy Morphs Options is in the Wasteland Offspring MCM</font>

content.help: Some for reason, I added a check for the player wearing a pipboy. Default : OFF
Allow Elderly NPC to get Pregnant. Default : OFF
Toggles if Pregnancy Cravings occur and how powerful they are. Default : 1X
How often does Pregnancy Cravings Occur. Monthly = Once per FPE Month, Pregnancy Cycle = look at 'Time Between Refreshes (Player)' Default : Per Pregnancy Cycle
Chances of Pregnancy Cravings Occurring. Default : 25
What type of Craving Message. Notification or Message Box. Default : Notification
Allows the player, if they can be pregnant and impregnate others, to attempt self-impregnation. To utilize this, you need to equip a condom, then masturbate. Default : OFF

content.text: Self Impregnation Clone vs Human Toggle
content.help: Changes Self Impregnation to force a clone of the player or just a human. (Requires INVB_WastelandOffspring) Default : Human
If you have sex and have condoms left, a new condom will be automatically equipped. Default : OFF
Select what is the outcome of using a condom - Nothing, Human Drop, Human and Creature Drop, Human Keep, Human and Creature Keep.
If you want Condoms to appear on Bodies when having Sex. Default : Glow or Matte

content.text: so Condoms are now sealed in a packet until it opened before sex scenes. (so they don't appear until required) Viagra Condom exist to help with Erection Issues(if required). 3D Mesh requires 3rd party mods to work (Haven't been updated yet).
How many Months before Birth, Can a viable baby be saved
content.help: how many months before the due date. can a dying baby appear on a dead pregnant mother. (so (Default Human Pregnancy Length)9 - 3(Default Viable Month) = After 6 Months) Default : 3
what are the chances for a dying baby appear on a dead pregnant mother. (or successful Perk chance) Default : 25
if a Medic Perk is required to recover a dying baby. Default : ON

content.text: One of the Medic Perks is Required for Babies to survive the death of their Mother. Medic 01 = Chance to recover a dying baby or nothing. Medic 02 = Chance to recover a dying baby or nothing. Medic 03 = Chance to recover a living baby or a dying baby. Medic 04 = 100% chance of recovering a living baby.

content.help: Straight to Child or Adult - (Baby), (Skip to Child), and (Skip to Adult). Default : Baby.
Straight to Child or Adult - (Baby), (Skip to Child), and (Skip to Adult). Default : Baby.

content.text: * The following options are for the unique Pregnancy that these factions have (WDF Offspring may be required)

content.help: Straight to Child or Adult - (Baby), (Skip to Child), and (Skip to Adult). Default : Baby.
Straight to Child or Adult - (Baby), (Skip to Child), and (Skip to Adult). Default : Baby.
Straight to Child or Adult - (Baby), (Skip to Child), and (Skip to Adult). Default : Baby.
Straight to Child or Adult - (Baby), (Skip to Child), and (Skip to Adult). Default : Baby.
Selecting a NPC or Player to be a Surrogate.
Selecting a NPC or Player to be a Surrogate.

content.text: <font size='10'> Player Based Commands (Have no Target in crosshair) or NPC Based Commands (Target with in crosshair)</font>

content.help: Toggles Post Partum. if Set then a number of effects will occur such as slower belly recovery, unable to get pregnant. Disabled, Player Only, Player and NPC within distance of player (1024 units), and Player and NPC. Default : Player Only

options: Player and NPC within distance of player

content.help: Minimum morph before Post partum is completed. (think of Months of pregnancy so 3 = looks like 3rd month of pregnancy) Default : 3 (Recommended)
How Much faster does PostPartum go. Instead of the standard refresh time of 12 hours, this will allow for smoother belly transformation.  Default : 12 (Recommended)
How powerful is the morph reduction. Default : 3 (Recommended)
Toggles that, if after the Post Partum Period. Infertility will occur for a while after. Default : ON
Toggles that, if during the Post Partum Period. Pregnancy can occur. Default : OFF
if the Player are allowed to have Post Partum then do they get an Perk or Not. Default : Perk
if NPCs are allowed to have Post Partum then do they get an Perk or Not. Default : Perk
Allows insemination from Non-Feral Ghouls. Default : OFF

content.text: Disallow Known and Unknown Synths insemination
content.help: Disallows Known and Unknown Synths to impregnate or be impregnated. Default : Disallows Known and Unknown Synths

content.text: <font size='12'>Known Synths = A-2018, B-263, B2-57, Curie, Institute Courser, Eve, F6-33, G9-81, Glory, K1-98, Nick Valentine, Shaun, X4-18, X6-88, X9-27, XPN-20A, Y9-15, Z1-14, Z2-47, Z2-47, Z3-22, Z3-22, Z4K-97B, Z4K-97B, Synths, and Timothy.</font>
<font size='12'>Unknown Synths = Amelia Stockton, Art, Burner, Carol Janssen, Danse, Gabriel, Magnolia, McDonough, Roger Warwick, Sturges.</font>
<font size='8'>* The above option requires you to download 'Spell Perk Item Distributor' from Nexus Otherwise it will not work</font>

content.help: Allows insemination from Hidden Synths Settlers. Default : Disallow
These settings only matter if Wasteland Offspring(from Wasteland Dairy Framework) is installed (Recommended)
Marks you as friendly if impregnated by them. Stays until Birth Unless Forever is selected Default : OFF

content.text: <font size='12'>Please Note that the Creature Faction Option does work but other factions may attack you for being aligned with creature faction.</font>

content.help: Removes Creature DNA after Sex. (via Impregnation or Condom) Default : OFF

content.text: <font size='12'>Please Note that the Synth Option also apply to Wasteland Offspring but they can have a human option as well.</font>

content.help: Allows determines potential insemination from anything other than Humans or Ghouls.  Default: Partial

content.text: Allow Creatures to use their own Chances
content.help: When this setting is on, an Creature will use its own chance to impregnate. (Options in Wasteland Offspring) Default : ON

content.text: <font size='14'>*Creature Pregnancy Length Options is in the Wasteland Offspring MCM</font>

<font size='16'> Off = No sex effects. 
 Partial = Every sex effect except insemination. 
 Full = Every sex effect including insemination.</font>

content.help: This is still in experimental stages with the new Alpha releases
Toggle if there is a limit to Pregnancies. Default : OFF

content.text: Total Number of NPC Pregnancies for all
content.help: Total Number of NPC Pregnancies. Default : 100 (Recommended)
Total Number of Player Pregnancies. Default : 25 (Recommended)
Toggles between freezing at Nothing, Birth(Forever Pregnancy), No Baby, Surrogacy(keeps going but no Baby), and Nongrowing Baby. Default: Nothing

content.text:
<font size='12'> 1. Freezing at Birth(Forever Pregnancy)
 2. No Baby perk (gives No Baby or Infanticide or Mutated Reproduction or Phantom Pregnancy)
 3. Both(Forever Pregnancies for already pregnant NPCs and no Pregnancies for Others)
 4. Surrogacy(keeps going but no Baby)
 5. Non Growing Baby (gives a Non Growing Baby to grow up later)</font>
<font size='12'> If you decide to turn limits off after using it for a while, please use some of the debug functions to resume Player or NPC Birth.</font>
<font size='12'> It is recommended to make this choice early on as changing these settings can have adverse effects.</font>

content.help: Reset Current Births for world
Reset Current Births for Player

content.text: <font size='16'> Debug Commands will still work if Limit is reached.</font>

content.help: Select if pregnancy Morphs are random - On, Off, Actor Based. Default : On
Select the CBBE body type you are using - CBBE, CBBE (WeightGain), CBBE (Pregnant Belly Only)
Select the Fusion Girl body type you are using - Fusion Girl, Fusion Girl (StaticPhobia), Fusion Girl (Pregnant Belly Only)

content.text:
<font size='16'> AAF FPE supports CBBE, Fusion Girl, and JaneBod female bodies. 
 You must have the specified body installed, with morphs built, for FPE pregnancy morphs to work. 
 Clothes must also have been built with morphs enabled in order for morphs to work on them. 
 </font>

content.help: Select whether or not to use the MPreg morph. Only enable this if your male body has an MPreg slider in BodySlide.

content.text:
<font size='16'> By default, pregnant males will gain weight each month. 
 AAF FPE also supports the MPreg morph add-on for Atomic Muscle and Body Talk 3. 
 If you have built your male body with the MPreg morph and enable MPreg morph support, pregnant males will have a growing belly instead of gaining weight.</font>

<font size='16'> Chances control how both NPCs and Player get pregnant. 
 Please see the considerations section if you are using other mods that leverage AAF.</font>

content.help: Base chance for pregnancy. Gets modified by following values in the order they appear here: Fertile Effects, Contraception Effects. Default : 3 (Recommended)
Giver(Male) Player chances for pregnancy. Gets modified by following values in the order they appear here: Fertile Effects, Contraception Effects. Default : 3 (Recommended)
Receiver(Female) Player chances for pregnancy. Gets modified by following values in the order they appear here: Fertile Effects, Contraception Effects. Default : 3 (Recommended)
Base chance for Ghoul pregnancy. Gets modified by following values in the order they appear here: Fertile Effects, Contraception Effects. Default : 3 (Recommended)
Base chance for IVF pregnancy. Gets modified by following values in the order they appear here: Fertile Effects, Contraception Effects. Default : 3 (Recommended)
The percentage contraception reduces from the modified pregnancy chance. Default : 90 (Recommended)
Chance that when NPCs have sex, they use contraceptives. Default : 30
Chance that mothers will birth more than one child. After 2 children, chances for more decrease. Default : 15 (Recommended)
The Chances for a gender to be selected at Birth(in Wasteland Offspring) or Growth(Default). Default : 50
Allow human babies to survive being borned. Default : 50
Length of Stillborn Grief Perks in days. Default : 3 Days.
Select if Fertility is On and which mode it is set to. (Disabled, Magic Effects, and Perk) Default : Perk
Chance for your character to wake up fertile/virile. If you are female and Female to Female impregnation is turned on, you will see be Fertile and Virile.  Default : 10 (Recommended)
The amount to multiply the base chance of pregnancy when fertile/virile. Default : 10 (Recommended)
Length of Fertility Perk in days. Default : 3 Days.
When this setting is on, an NPC has the chance to be fertile/virile when loaded into the FPE system. Default : ON
NPCs chance of being fertile is the Fertile Percent Chance multiplied by this setting's value. Default : 0.5 (Half the chance as the player) (Recommended)
Select if Infertility is On and which mode it is set to. (Disabled, Infertile, and Normal) Default : Perk
Length of Infertility Perks in days. Default : 3 Days.
if you want Sterility, which causes no pregnancies on affected NPC. Default : ON

content.text:
<font size='12'> Disabled = Infertility is Disabled. 
 Infertile = Pregnancy chances is Decreased 
 Normal = Normal Pregnancy Chances. (This will negate getting fertile for a length of time) 
 Please Note, this option is designed for Infertility drug use and the after effects to PostPartum and Fertility.</font>
Human Baby to Child Growth Time (FPE Months)
content.help: How long it takes for a Human baby to grow into a child, in FPE months. Automatically affects currently alive babies. Default : 36 FP Months

content.text: Ghoul Baby to Child Growth Time (FPE Months)
content.help: How long it takes for a Ghoul baby to grow into a child, in FPE months. Automatically affects currently alive babies. Default : 36 FP Months

content.text: <font size='14'>*Creature Baby to Child Options is in the Wasteland Offspring MCM</font>

content.help: The max amount of babies a pregnant person can birth. Default: 3 (Recommended)

Baby's health and radiation is tracked. Doing chems, drinking, getting hit in combat, eating or taking rads in all affect your baby.
Stimpaks and Radaway and doctors can heal the damage, and health recovers over time naturally. Default : ON
If the rads accumulated are equal to or greater than 400, the child with be a ghoul. If the father of the child is a ghoul, the child will also be a ghoul. Default : ON
When a baby is  born, found or picked up, what else happens. Note: Wearable babies can be modded at an armour workbench. Default : Adds Wearable Baby

options: Adds and Equips Wearable Baby (Not to Player)
Adds and Equips Wearable Baby (to Player as well)

content.help: The Chances a Father with a specific racial perk that they will father a selected racial baby. Default : 50

content.text: Chances for Mothers DNA (for human to human only)
content.help: The Chances for the mother to use Racial perks. Default : 50

content.text:
<font size='12'> Choose the race of a particular actor (White, Black, etc...) to allow particular children to be born 
 So the following commands adds a perk to the Player or NPC.
 There is no special abilities given to each Race Perk. (In fact the Perk is simply a visible Way to keep track)</font>

This Adds a Black Race Perk to a NPC or Player. (and Remove other Racial Perks)
This Adds a Hispanic Race Perk to a NPC or Player. (and Remove other Racial Perks)
This Adds a White Race Perk to a NPC or Player. (and Remove other Racial Perks)
This Resets The Race Perk for a NPC or Player.

content.text:
<font size='10'> Navigate to C:\Users\YOURUSERIDHERE\Documents\My Games\Fallout4\Fallout4.ini 
 Open it, and copy and paste the following to the bottom of the textfile 
 [Papyrus] 
 fPostLoadUpdateTimeMS=500.0 
 bEnableLogging=1 
 bEnableTrace=1 
 bLoadDebugInformation=1 
 (logs are stored in C:\Users\YOURUSERIDHERE\Documents\My Games\Fallout4\Logs\Script) </font>

content.text:
Normal Pregnancy = this is normal, it does nothing therefore the baby is born like normal. 
 Sterility = NPCs will never get Pregnant or Father a child. 
 No Baby = Completely removes the baby. 
 Infanticide = Mother will kill the baby 
 Mutated Reproduction = The Mother's Reproductive system to far too damaged to produce a child 
 Phantom Pregnancy = The Mother has a phantom pregnancy which means that there is no baby. 
 Poor Lifestyle = 50% chance of surviving baby or dead baby. 
 Stillborn = The Baby will die when born. 
 Surrogate = The mother will sell the baby. 
 Random = any of the above

1. Exit game. 
 2. Open Bodyslide. 
 3. Tick Build Morphs and build meshes.
If you or NPCs are not getting Pregnant

1. Go to Debug page 3 
 2. Click Impregnate 
 3. See if that works 
 or 
 1. Craft the Frogless Fertility Test Kit or cheat one(XX00C167) 
 2. Use it on NPC (or yourself but move away from others before using it) 
 3. Take screenshot of Message and upload it to the loverslab thread
If you still have a big belly after birth

1. Post Partum has been enabled 
 2. Simply wait it out, the belly will get smaller over time 
 3. After post partum is completed then you can disable it if you like
